Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "AndroidCreatePackagePerAbi not working on VS4Mac 8.3 preview" (#3394) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. create xamarin.forms app with configuration as below in android
2. rebuild and archieve for publish
3. 

```
 <PropertyGroup Condition=" '$(Configuration)|$(Platform)' == 'Release|AnyCPU' ">
    <Optimize>false</Optimize>
    <OutputPath>bin\Release\</OutputPath>
    <DefineConstants>TRACE</DefineConstants>
    <ErrorReport>prompt</ErrorReport>
    <WarningLevel>4</WarningLevel>
    <AndroidUseSharedRuntime>False</AndroidUseSharedRuntime>
    <DebugType>
    </DebugType>
    <AndroidLinkMode>Full</AndroidLinkMode>
    <EmbedAssembliesIntoApk>true</EmbedAssembliesIntoApk>
    <AndroidCreatePackagePerAbi>true</AndroidCreatePackagePerAbi>
    <JavaMaximumHeapSize>1G</JavaMaximumHeapSize>
    <AotAssemblies>true</AotAssemblies>
    <EnableLLVM>true</EnableLLVM>
    <AndroidAotAdditionalArguments>no-write-symbols,nodebug</AndroidAotAdditionalArguments>
    <DebugSymbols>false</DebugSymbols>
    <BundleAssemblies>true</BundleAssemblies>
    <Debugger>Xamarin</Debugger>
    <AndroidEnableMultipleDex>true</AndroidEnableMultipleDex>
    <AndroidExplicitCrunch>true</AndroidExplicitCrunch>
    <AndroidKeyStore>True</AndroidKeyStore>    <AndroidSigningKeyStore>../../Keystore/app_cert/app_cert.keystore</AndroidSigningKeyStore>
    <AndroidEnableProfiledAot>true</AndroidEnableProfiledAot>
    <AndroidEnableSGenConcurrent>true</AndroidEnableSGenConcurrent>
    <AndroidUseAapt2>true</AndroidUseAapt2>
    <AndroidSupportedAbis>armeabi-v7a;x86;x86_64;arm64-v8a</AndroidSupportedAbis>
  </PropertyGroup>
```

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Expected Behavior
it should create 4 apks per abi configuration and it used to work in previous versions
### Actual Behavior
it generates only one big apk but no split apks

Opened pull request "Bump to mono/mono/2019-06@761220d9" (#3392) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Reopened issue "Link assemblies causes app crashes if you have an EditText in VS2019 Preview 2" (#3263) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Add an EditText
2. Choose TextChanged. (Example:  `txtSearch.TextChanged += TxtSearch_TextChanged;`)
3. Choose Linking with either "Sdk Assemblies Only" or "Sdk and User Assemblies".
4. Execute the program.

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Expected Behavior

Be able to execute the TextChanged on Linking with either "Sdk Assemblies Only" or "Sdk and User Assemblies".

### Actual Behavior

App crashes because it cannot load ITextWatcherInvoker.

### Version Information

Windows 10, May Update.
Visual Studio 2019 Preview 2.

### Log File

> System.TypeLoadException: 'Could not load type 'Android.Text.ITextWatcherInvoker' from assembly 'Mono.Android, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null'.'

![Annotation 2019-06-20 003519](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1666156/59806029-54449600-92f3-11e9-9df5-b3c453facd90.png)

**P.S.**

It's working in Visual Studio for Mac.

> VS bug [#947890](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/947890)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "SIGSEGV in Release mode when Linking enabled" (#3390) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
After the update to Visual Studio 16.2.0 my Android app crashes in several activities throughout the app. It is somehow related to attaching event handlers .

### Steps to Reproduce
```
var locSearch = FindViewById<AutoCompleteTextView>(Resource.Id.locSearch);
locSearch.TextChanged += (s, e) => { }; // this causes the crash
```
Repro project: [App1.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/3433344/App1.zip)

### Expected Behavior
No crashes

### Actual Behavior
App crashes in Release mode when Linking set to "SDK Assemblies only" or "SDK and User Assemblies"

### Version Information
Visual Studio Enterprise 16.2.0
Xamarin.Android SDK 9.4.0.51

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Remove Mono submodule" (#3371) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
One of the goals behind the Mono SDK/archive was to enable product builds
without having the entire Mono source present which means it should be possible
to remove Mono git submodule and build entire Xamarin.Android without any
issues. At the same time, we want to keep the ability to build Mono from source,
if necessary, for situations when a developer works on the BCL or the runtime
itself and there's no appropriate binary archive present. To that effect, this
commit implements the following:

  * Remove Mono submodule
  * Put Mono repo reference to the `.external` file
  * Make distinction between "commercial" and "regular" bits in the `.external`
    file so that we don't attempt to check out everything mentioned in there in
    situations when a developer doesn't have access to the commercial bits.
  * Use Mono linker sources from the archive
  * Remove `zlib-helper.c` from the `libmonodroid` build - the API implemented
    in there is no longer used by Mono.
  * `Xamarin.Android.Cecil.dll` and `Xamarin.Android.Cecil.Mdb.dll` are no
    longer built from source. Instead we use `Cecil` to reshape `Mono.Cecil` and
    conjure the two renamed and re-signed assemblies.
  * All the code which used `Xamarin.Android.Cecil` project reference now simply
    references the conjured asseblies (which are also added to the bundle)
  * Third Party Notices are generated from licenses found in the Mono archive.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug] IsEnabled does not work for Button" (#6991) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
#6772 # Description
I have set IsEnabled="false" to a button. But it doesn't disable the button.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a Button
2. add property **IsEnabled**
3.  set values ="false"

### Expected Behavior
Disable the button and should not fire click events

### Actual Behavior
Fires the click event

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: Xamarin.Forms 4.1
- Last known good version: 3.5
- IDE: Visual Studio 2017 Community/Enterprise
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - iOS:  12.3
  - Android: 9.0

- Android Support Library Version: v7
- Nuget Packages: Xamarin.Forms, Xamarin.Essentials
- Affected Devices: All

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug] [UWP] OnMeasure does not get called until moving the mouse" (#6662) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
I am loading a set of data which triggers the UI to update by calling InvalidateLayout.  Instead of then calling OnMeasure on the same control it appears to stall until I move the mouse or tap on the screen on a touch screen device.  The CPU remains at zero for this time period.

This is less obvious on devices using mouse as you tend to use the mouse as you navigate around however is causing issues testing on touchscreen devices as you have to tap on the screen to trigger the display of data.

This does not occur on iOS or Android builds.

### Expected Behavior
Calling InvalidateLayout triggers a layout pass.

### Actual Behavior
Layout pass doesn't occur until mouse moves

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 4.0.0.497661
- Last known good version: None
- IDE: Visual Studio 2019
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - UWP:  16299

Some minor changes to the Android CollectionView implementation to make custom renderers easier (specifically an overrideable method for creating a custom spacing decoration). 

Plus a demo using the StaggeredGridLayoutManager.

### API Changes ###

None

### Platforms Affected ### 

- Android

### Behavioral/Visual Changes ###

None

### Before/After Screenshots ### 

Not applicable

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[UWP] ListView.GroupHeaderTemplate applies a different FontSize on Label" (#6956) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
When setting up a ListView with a custom GroupHeaderTemplate, and using the same template to define the ItemSourceTemplate, it produces some strange results when you haven't explicitly set a FontSize.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a standard XF App
2. Add the following code into your MainPage...
```XAML
<ListView IsGroupingEnabled="True">
     <ListView.GroupHeaderTemplate>
         <DataTemplate>
               <ViewCell>
                   <Label Text="{Binding Header}" />
              </ViewCell>
         </DataTemplate>
    </ListView.GroupHeaderTemplate>
    <ListView.ItemTemplate>
        <DataTemplate>
             <ViewCell>
                 <Label Text="{Binding .}" />
             </ViewCell>
        </DataTemplate>
    </ListView.ItemTemplate>
</ListView>
```
3. Setup the ItemSource to be a list compatible with Grouping (e.g, as follows...)

``` C#
public class TempObj : List<string> {
    public TempObj(IEnumerable<string> content) : base(content) { }
    public string Header { get; set; }
}
```

```Xaml
<ListView.ItemsSource>
      <x:Array Type="{x:Type testapp:TestObj}">
               <testapp:TestObj>
                       <testapp:TestObj.Header>
                              <x:String>Header 1</x:String>
                       </testapp:TestObj.Header>
                       <x:Arguments>
                             <x:Array Type="{x:Type x:String}">
                                    <x:String>Content 1</x:String>
                                    <x:String>Content 2</x:String>
                                    <x:String>Content 3</x:String>
                               </x:Array>
                       </x:Arguments>
                </testapp:TestObj>
```

(sorry for poor formatting)

### Expected Behavior
FontSizes to be the same, as in the Android and iOS deployments.

### Actual Behavior
The FontSize of the GroupHeader's Label becomes larger than the ItemSource's Label

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.5.0.169047
- Last known good version: n/a
- IDE: Visual Studio 2019 Enterprise 16.1.6
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - iOS: 12.10 <!-- The version of the iOS SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 11.1 -->
  - Android: 9.0.3 <!-- The version of the Android SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 7.1 --> 
  - UWP: 16299 <!-- The version of the UWP SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 16299 --> 
- Android Support Library Version: n/a <!-- if applicable -->
- Nuget Packages: n/a
- Affected Devices: Windows 10 Devices

### Screenshots
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25750702/61714073-e35d2780-ad51-11e9-82fa-b0cbacd77314.png)

<!-- If the issue is a visual issue, please include screenshots showing the problem if possible -->

### Reproduction Link

<!-- Please upload or provide a link to a reproduction case -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "ios: raise touch event on touchbegin." (#6989) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

Under ContextActionCell.cs for iOS under the SelectGestureRecognizer overrode the TouchesBegan method to call Tapped method that passes Tapped event to VeiwCell

### Issues Resolved ### 
- fixes #3320 

### API Changes ###

Added:
public override void TouchesBegan(NSSet touches, UIEvent evt)

Changed:
none
 
 Removed:
none
 
 -->
 
 None

### Platforms Affected ### 
<!-- Please list all platforms affected by these changes -->


- iOS

### Behavioral/Visual Changes ###
A list View will now select an item when an item is first tapped, not when the tap is released. The recycleelement listview will behave the same as the Retain Element

### Before/After Screenshots ### 
Before
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51649153/61980795-badd6380-afc5-11e9-9386-3fe8b7c9f87c.png)

After
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51649153/61980763-aa2ced80-afc5-11e9-9d5a-8336ebbd2017.png)



### Testing Procedure ###
On iOS.
Have a listview with cachingstrategy set to Recycle Element
Press on an Item but do not release your pointer. The item will not select
Item is selected on release

After the change you will see that the item is select on Pressing of the pointer.

### PR Checklist ###

- [X] Has automated tests <!-- (if tests are omitted or manual, state reason in description) -->
- [X] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [ X] Changes adhere to coding standard

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[CFNetwork] Non-implementation of new API in Xcode 11 beta 1-4." (#6663) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
The missing fields are all new fields in existing groups of fields, of which
we've bound none.

Continue the trend, and just update xtro.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Xamarin does not install an older version to support older systems" (#6648) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Use a Mac (Macbook 7,1) which is only limited to MacOS 10.13.6 through normal means (10.14 is possible through modified installations, but I do not feel safe yet doing so)
2. Install Visual Studio normally through the website process
3. Install XCode 10.1 through https://developer.apple.com/download/ as that is the last version to support 10.13 (XCode 10.2, is a macOS 10.14 and higher requirement) 

### Expected Behavior
Xamarin.Mac should still operate on XCode 10.1, and Visual Studio/Xamarin does not attempt to install an older version that does support a copy of XCode that is installed on the machine
### Actual Behavior
Simply recieved error:
"/Users/mac/Documents/Visual Studio/LearningVisualStudioMac/LearningVisualStudioMac/MMP: Warning MM0079: The recommended Xcode version for Xamarin.Mac 5.10.0 is Xcode 10.2 or later. The current Xcode version (found in /Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer) is 10.1. (MM0079)"

### Environment
Visual Studio for Mac on Macbook 7,1 running macOS 10.13.6

=== Visual Studio Community 2019 for Mac ===

Version 8.1.4 (build 5)
Installation UUID: 5a34fc03-c28c-47ec-ba8c-d27a387b1f22
	GTK+ 2.24.23 (Raleigh theme)
	Xamarin.Mac 5.6.0.25 (d16-0 / 50f75273)

	Package version: 518010028

	Package version: 518010028
